team.name: evac-ops
team.description: Joint task force coordinating embassy evacuation operations under hostile conditions

channel.name: crisis-action-team
channel.purpose: Command-level decisions for evacuation operations - principals only
channel.header: **CRISIS COMMAND CENTER** - State/DoD/IC leadership only. All decisions require immediate action. [EVAC CONPLAN](https://crisis.state.gov/evac)

channel.name: evac-airlift
channel.purpose: Flight manifest coordination and airlift operations
channel.header: **AIRLIFT COORDINATION** - Manifest updates required before boarding. State Dept controls passenger priority. [Manifest System](https://evac.state.gov/manifest)

channel.name: intel-feed
channel.purpose: Real-time threat intelligence from CIA/NSA/DIA fusion cell
channel.header: **TS/SCI INTEL FEED** - Insurgent movements, SIGINT, satellite imagery. Immediate dissemination authorized.

channel.name: route-security
channel.purpose: Convoy route status and checkpoint coordination with host nation
channel.header: **ROUTE STATUS** - All convoys require armed escort. Host nation liaison required. Emergency: Channel 9 tactical.

channel.name: convoy-ops
channel.purpose: Bus movement coordination to airport - real-time tracking
channel.header: **CONVOY TRACKING** - GPS mandatory. Report position every 10 minutes. Duress code: THUNDERBOLT

channel.name: personnel-accountability
channel.purpose: Check-in system for all personnel awaiting evacuation
channel.header: **ACCOUNTABILITY** - All personnel must check in via mobile app. Missing persons report immediately.

channel.name: threat-assessment
channel.purpose: Hostile force tracking and threat analysis
channel.header: **THREAT ANALYSIS** - Insurgent positions, weapons assessments, attack predictions. QRF on standby.

channel.name: medevac-coordination
channel.purpose: Coordinate medical evacuations and casualty transport
channel.header: **MEDEVAC OPS** - Priority 1 casualties only. Landing zones must be secured. Trauma team at airport.

channel.name: host-nation-liaison
channel.purpose: Coordination with local military and police forces via interpreters
channel.header: **HOST NATION COORD** - All requests through official channels. Interpreters available 24/7.

channel.name: embassy-security
channel.purpose: Perimeter defense and embassy compound security updates
channel.header: **EMBASSY DEFENSE** - Marines hold perimeter. DS controls compound. Burn classified materials on order.

channel.name: weather-operations
channel.purpose: Weather conditions affecting air and ground evacuation operations
channel.header: **WEATHER OPS** - Flight minimums critical. Dust storms common. Visibility updates every 30 min.

channel.name: flight-tracking
channel.purpose: Track incoming and outgoing evacuation flights
channel.header: **FLIGHT TRACKING** - C-17s inbound/outbound. Maintain radio silence until final approach.

post.message:
**COMPOUND STATUS - CRITICAL**

Perimeter breached at northwest wall. Marines falling back to inner compound.
- Gate 1: SECURE (reinforced)
- Gate 2: COMPROMISED - crowd surge
- Gate 3: SECURE (Marines holding)

@security_forces Weapons free authorized for compound defense. ROE DELTA in effect.

replies.message: DS agents destroying classified materials. Need 30 minutes minimum.
Copy weapons free. Establishing final defensive line at chancery.

post.message:
**TS//SCI FLASH INTEL**

NSA intercepts indicate coordinated insurgent assault planned for 1800L:
- 3 VBIED teams identified approaching from south
- MANPADS confirmed in sector 7
- Enemy strength estimated 800+ fighters

@intelligence_fusion_cell Priority: identify safe corridors for convoy movement

**CONVOY MANIFEST - URGENT**

First convoy loading NOW:
- Bus 1: 65 AmCits (families priority)
- Bus 2: 45 embassy staff
- Bus 3: 30 TCN contractors

@evacuation_ops_team Armed escort vehicles in position. Awaiting route clearance.

replies.message: Manifest confirmed. All passengers accounted for with evacuation passes.

post.message:
Host nation forces report:
- Airport highway: BLOCKED by crowds at km 3
- Irish route: CLEAR but unverified
- Camp Sullivan route: Heavy fighting reported

My units can provide escort through Irish route. Need confirmation in 5 minutes.

replies.message: Satellite imagery confirms Irish route viable. Two checkpoints but appear friendly.

post.message:
**AIRLIFT STATUS**

C-17 tail #89-1192 on final approach. ETA 15 minutes.
- Capacity: 400 pax
- Next aircraft: 45 minutes out
- Total sorties available: 8

@david.wright Need manifest finalized for first flight NOW.

replies.message: All gates sealed. No foot traffic until further notice.

post.message:
**ACCOUNTABILITY UPDATE - 1430L**

Accounted for: 1,247 personnel
Missing: 23 (last seen in housing compound)
Unaccounted: 156 (includes local staff)

Mobile check-in system showing intermittent failures. Manual counts ongoing.

**WEATHER WARNING - KABUL AIRPORT**

Dust storm approaching from west:
- Visibility dropping to 1/4 mile
- Winds 35G45 knots
- Impact time: 30 minutes

Recommend expediting current C-17 landing. May need to suspend ops.

**CASUALTY REPORT**

- 3x Priority 1 (GSW) - immediate evac required
- 7x Priority 2 (blast injuries) - can wait 2 hours
- 15x Priority 3 (minor injuries)

@medical_team Trauma bay at airport overwhelmed. Need field surgical team at embassy.

replies.message: Field team deploying via armored ambulance. ETA 20 minutes if route stays clear.

post.message:
My police units report armed groups moving toward airport from three directions. We can hold airport road for maybe 2 more hours maximum.

Need immediate decision on convoy departure.

**CONVOY LAUNCH - EXECUTE**

Irish route confirmed. First convoy departing NOW.
- Lead: MRAP with .50 cal
- 3 buses with 140 personnel
- Trail: 2 up-armored SUVs

All vehicles check in every 2 minutes. Duress code: THUNDERBOLT

C-17 #89-1192 on ground. Loading commenced.

Priority manifest:
1. Wounded (with medical escort)
2. Unaccompanied minors
3. Embassy families
4. Critical personnel

30 minutes to fully load. Dust storm closing in.

**SITREP - 1445L**

Embassy compound: 60% evacuated
Convoy 1: En route via Irish
Airport: First C-17 loading
Threat level: CRITICAL

@sarah.mitchell Recommend initiating destruction of remaining classified and preparing final evacuation wave.

Final classified destruction complete. Embassy ready for abandonment.

Marine detail preparing to evacuate to airport via helicopters from compound roof.

Last DS agents departing with ambassador.

**URGENT - WEATHER CLOSURE**

Dust storm hitting airport NOW. Visibility zero.

C-17 #89-1192 holding short of runway. Cannot depart.
Next inbound diverting to Bagram.

Estimate 45-60 minutes before conditions improve.

**ROUTE UPDATE - 1500L**

Drone surveillance showing:
- Irish route: 2 IEDs discovered, EOD required
- Airport highway: Massive crowd buildup at terminal
- Southern approach: Clear but unprotected

@rashid.ahmad Can your forces clear the IEDs?

replies.message: EOD team dispatched. 20 minutes to clear. Keep convoys holding.
Copy. Convoy 2 holding at rally point Alpha.

post.message:
**MISSING PERSONS ALERT**

17 contractors unaccounted for from housing compound:
- Last seen: 1200L during rocket attack
- Possible location: Shelter bunker or departed on own

@security_forces Need sweep team to check bunkers

replies.message: Can't spare Marines for bunker sweep. All forces committed to perimeter.
I'll take two DS agents and check. Give us 15 minutes.

post.message:
**PRIORITY INTEL - IMMINENT THREAT**

Assets report 3 technicals with heavy weapons moving toward airport from east. ETA 20 minutes.

Recommend immediate departure of loaded aircraft regardless of weather.

replies.message: Scrambling Apache gunships from Bagram. 15 minutes out.

post.message:
Tower just cleared us for emergency departure. C-17 rolling in 5 minutes.

- 387 personnel on board
- 12 stretcher cases
- 23 unaccompanied minors

Pushing throttles regardless of visibility.

replies.message: Godspeed. Visibility improving slightly. Should be clear at altitude.

post.message:
Field surgical team at embassy. Found 5 contractors in bunker with blast injuries.

Need immediate CASEVAC to airport. Can convoy 2 divert for pickup?

replies.message: Negative on convoy divert. Send coordinates - I'll dispatch armored ambulance.

post.message:
**COMPOUND ABANDONED - 1510L**

Last Marines lifting off via CH-53. Embassy is empty.

Flag retrieved. Charges set on crypto vault.

See you at the airport.

replies.message: Well done, Marines. History will remember your courage today.

post.message:
WARNING: My officers at airport report panic in crowds. People trying to breach runway.

Military units struggling to maintain control. Shots fired over heads to disperse.

replies.message: ROE remains non-lethal for crowd control. No exceptions without my authorization.

post.message:
SIGINT flash: Intercepted radio traffic indicates MANPADS team positioning north of runway.

All aircraft advised - maximum rate climb on departure. Deploy countermeasures.

replies.message: Confirming MANPADS signature via thermal imaging. Grid 42SWB445789.

post.message:
**CONVOY 2 ROLLING**

IEDs cleared. 185 evacuees aboard:
- Embassy local staff
- Western contractors
- Some family members

Taking southern approach per intel recommendation.

replies.message: Drone providing overwatch. Route clear so far.

post.message:
**FLASH UPDATE**

Apaches engaging technicals east of airport. Threat neutralized.

Airport perimeter holding but situation deteriorating. Estimate 2-3 hours before position becomes untenable.

@sarah.mitchell Recommend accelerating evacuation timeline.

replies.message: Agreed. All remaining convoys launch immediately. No more holding for stragglers.
Roger. Final sweep of embassy district in progress.

post.message:
Dust storm passing. Visibility improving to 2 miles.

Winds still gusty but within limits for C-130 operations.

Clear weather window expected for next 3 hours.

Found 11 contractors in bunker - all alive but shaken. Bringing them out now.

6 still missing. Checking alternate shelter.

replies.message: Updated count: 1,396 accounted for. Getting close to full accountability.

post.message:
Geospatial analysis shows insurgent forces massing 5km south of airport.

Estimate 1,000+ fighters with vehicles. Appears to be staging for major assault.

Time is running out.

**MASS CASUALTY EVENT**

Convoy 2 casualties arriving:
- 3x Priority 1 (critical)
- 8x Priority 2 (urgent)
- Multiple walking wounded

Need all medical personnel to triage area NOW.

replies.message: En route with supplies. ETA 2 minutes.

post.message:
My commander ordering withdrawal of host nation forces from airport.

I'm staying with my American friends, but losing most support in 30 minutes.

This is not good.

replies.message: Colonel Ahmad, your loyalty will not be forgotten. Ensure you and your men are on the evacuation list.

post.message:
Marines consolidating at airport. Setting up final defensive positions.

North gate: 2 squads
South gate: 2 squads  
Runway security: 1 platoon

We'll hold as long as needed.

North gate temporarily closed due to VBIED attack. Diverting all arrivals to south gate.

@medical_team Multiple casualties from blast. Need immediate support.

**FINAL CONVOY LAUNCHING**

This is the last run. 210 personnel including:
- Remaining embassy staff
- Local employees with visas
- Allied nation citizens

If you're not on this convoy, you won't make it out by ground.

Second wave of dust approaching from northwest. Heavier than first.

Impact in 45 minutes. Will shut down flight ops for at least 2 hours.

Whatever flies now may be our last sortie.

C-130 on ground. Combat offload in progress.

Loading wounded first, then families. 5 minutes on ground max.

Engines running, props turning.

**FINAL COUNT UPDATE**

Evacuated: 1,126
At airport: 347  
Final convoy: 210
Unaccounted: 43

Time to close the books. We saved who we could.

North gate MASCAL:
- 7 KIA (including 2 Marines)
- 15 wounded stabilized
- Loading critical cases on C-130 now

These people died saving others.

replies.message: We can hold for 3-4 hours. Ammunition running low. Need emergency resupply or extraction plan.

post.message:
Radio chatter indicates insurgent commander offering safe passage for remaining evacuees.

Do not trust this. It's a trap. They want hostages.

My men and I will fight with you.

**CRITIC FLASH**

B-52 strike package authorized by CENTCOM. Target: insurgent staging areas.

Time on target: 20 minutes. Danger close to airport.

All personnel take cover in hardened structures.

Dust storm hitting NOW. Zero visibility.

All flight operations suspended. Tower evacuating to bunker.

Hunker down, people. This is going to be rough.

Lost all ISR feeds due to weather. Flying blind.

Last known: 500+ insurgents inside airport perimeter wire.

Expect ground assault under cover of storm.

Field hospital established in terminal baggage area:
- 47 wounded under treatment
- Blood supplies critical
- Need dust masks for everyone

Doing our best with what we have.

All units - ALAMO protocol activated.

Consolidate all remaining personnel in main terminal. Abandon outer perimeter.

We make our stand here. B-52s inbound ETA 10 minutes.

Emergency headcount in terminal:
- 347 civilians
- 89 military
- 23 wounded
- 15 host nation allies

Everyone accounted for. We're all in this together.

replies.message: Strike authorized. May God help us all.

post.message:
Terminal secure. All entry points barricaded.

Marines and DS agents integrated defense. Host nation forces solid.

300 meters and closing. This is it.

replies.message: Negative. Can't spare anyone. They'll have to hold until after strikes.

post.message:
My men holding perimeter for your evacuation. This is goodbye, my friends.

We'll buy you time. Get your people out.

It's been an honor.

replies.message: Negative Colonel. You and your men board that plane. That's an order from the U.S. Ambassador.

post.message:
Insurgents regrouping 2km south. Estimate 15 minutes before they can mount another assault.

C-17 needs to be wheels up in 10 minutes maximum.

Security forces collapsing perimeter in phases:
- Outer teams falling back
- Middle teams ready to move
- Final team holds until aircraft loaded

Textbook retrograde under fire.

Back wall of storm 5 minutes out. CAT III turbulence expected.

Once that bird takes off, nothing else flies for hours.

This is literally our last chance.

Loading at maximum rate:
- 150 aboard in 2 minutes
- 200 more moving
- Wounded all secure

Incredible discipline. No panic.

All wounded aboard. Medical team last to board.

Leaving medical supplies for locals. It's all we can do.

God help those we leave behind.

To all personnel - we accomplished the impossible today.

1,683 lives saved. Heroes among us.

Now let's get these people home safe. Well done, everyone. Well done.

Aircraft clear of threat envelope. No further SAM activity detected.

Kabul airport now under insurgent control.

We were the last flight out.

**FINAL ACCOUNTABILITY**

Total evacuated: 1,683
US citizens: 423
Allied nationals: 217  
Local staff saved: 389
Others assisted: 654

We left no one behind who could be saved.

My family is aboard thanks to you. My country may fall, but my children will live.

America kept its promise. We will never forget.

Thank you, my friends. Thank you.

Security debrief preliminary:
- 7 KIA (5 host nation, 2 US)
- 31 WIA (all evacuated)
- Zero missing/captured
- All classified destroyed

Those who fell died as heroes. We'll bring them home.

C-17 cleared storm system. Smooth air at FL280.

Diverting to Al Dhafra for fuel and medical.

ETA: 90 minutes to friendly ground.

To all convoy drivers and escorts:

You drove through hell to save lives. Every person on that plane owes their life to your courage.

Beers are on me when we land. You've earned it.

Pilot reports all systems nominal. Aircraft handling heavy load well.

447 personnel heading home. Largest single evacuation lift in recent history.

Air Mobility Command sends congratulations.

Imagery shows airport overrun. Embassy compound burning.

But everyone who matters is safe at 28,000 feet.

Intel community proud to have supported this operation.

Final weather report: Kabul airport now experiencing full sandstorm. Zero visibility.

We got out just in time. 5 minutes later would have been too late.

Sometimes luck is part of the mission.

Consular teams preparing for arrivals:
- Temporary visas ready
- Refugee processing expedited  
- Family reunification priority
- Military families fast-tracked

No bureaucracy will delay these heroes' welcome.

DS After Action note:

Every single classified system destroyed per protocol. Zero compromise.

Embassy may be lost, but America's secrets are safe.

Textbook execution under fire.

Station closing final transmission:

All assets exfiltrated. Networks sanitized. Sources protected.

20 years of work ended in 20 hours. But we got our people out.

See you at headquarters.

**30 MINUTES TO LANDING**

Al Dhafra approach cleared. Medical teams standing by.

Refuel and onward to Germany, then home.

The journey isn't over, but the hardest part is behind us.

Teaching my son English on the plane. He asks why Americans came back for us.

I told him: 'Because that's what friends do.'

He wants to be a Marine now. Like Colonel Jones.

replies.message: Tell him the Corps would be honored. Semper Fi, Ahmad family.

post.message:
Convoy drivers comparing notes:
- 67 IED scares
- 14 firefights
- 389 lives saved
- 0 vehicles lost
- 100% mission success

Flawless execution under impossible conditions.

Personal message to all:

In 40 years of service, I've never seen such courage, dedication, and humanity.

You turned chaos into coordination, fear into hope, impossible into accomplished.

America is proud. I am proud. Thank you.

All wounded stable for onward movement. No in-flight casualties.

Considering what we went through - remarkable.

Every medic, nurse, and doctor deserves recognition.

Al Dhafra weather perfect. Clear skies, calm winds.

After what we flew through, this feels like paradise.

Mother Nature gave us hell, then showed mercy.

Disembarkation orderly:
- Medical cases first
- Families with children
- Elderly and disabled
- All others by manifest

Hot meals and showers waiting. You've earned both.

Threat level at Al Dhafra: MINIMAL

Base security augmented. No regional threats.

For the first time in 72 hours, you can breathe easy.

Marines accountability: All present.

Weapons secured. Wounded getting treatment.

First Sergeant already planning memorial for our fallen.

Semper Fidelis.

Debrief schedule:
- Hot wash: 2 hours
- Formal debrief: Tomorrow 0800
- Lessons learned: Within 72 hours

Get some rest first. You've all earned it.

Next leg planning:
- Al Dhafra to Ramstein: 0200 departure
- C-17 crew resting (mandatory)
- Fresh crew inbound
- Weather looks good entire route

Almost home, folks.

My men being processed for Special Immigrant Visas.

US keeping promise to those who helped. This means everything.

We lost our country but found true allies.

Hot wash initial findings:
- Armor packages worked perfectly
- Comms discipline outstanding
- Route selection saved lives
- Cross-training paid off

Every lesson learned matters. We'll document everything.

SECDEF and POTUS send personal thanks.

'Operation Safe Haven exemplifies American values. Every agency, every service member, every civilian showed extraordinary heroism.'

Your actions today made history.

Chaplain services available hangar 5:
- All faiths welcome
- Counselors standing by
- Peer support groups forming

What we experienced changes people. No shame in needing help.

Kabul update: Airport completely obscured by sandstorm.

No movement possible for next 6-8 hours minimum.

We truly got out at the last possible moment.

Logistics update:
- All evacuees fed and hydrated
- Temporary quarters assigned
- Medical rounds complete
- Communications home arranged

Taking care of our people.

Final security summary:
- Zero classified compromised
- All accountable items recovered
- Embassy denial operations successful
- Personnel 100% extracted

Mission success by every metric.

Intelligence community after-action:

Fusion cell concept worked. Real-time intel sharing saved lives.

Every analyst, every operator contributed to success.

Proud to serve with you all.

Ramstein notified of incoming:
- Medical facilities alerted
- Refugee processing ready
- Transportation arranged
- Welcome committee forming

Germany rolling out red carpet for heroes.

Wounded status update:
- All critical cases upgraded to stable
- Surgery requirements identified
- Ramstein surgical teams briefed
- Zero losses post-evacuation

100% survival rate. Incredible.

Teaching American history to fellow evacuees.

They ask why US military so brave. I tell them:

'Because they fight for ideals, not just land. Today you saw those ideals in action.'

Many want to serve new country.

Convoy equipment accountability:
- All sensitive items recovered
- Weapons secured and counted
- Crypto gear destroyed per protocol
- Vehicles sanitized

Leaving nothing for enemy exploitation.

Final message as Crisis Action Team lead:

We faced the impossible and prevailed. Not through individual heroics, but through teamwork, dedication, and trust.

Every person here is a hero. Never forget what we accomplished together.

Mission complete. Stand down with pride.

**EARLIER - DAY 1 OF CRISIS**

Initial threat assessment:
- Embassy district surrounded
- Multiple rocket teams positioned
- Crowds forming at all gates

Recommend immediate NEO planning.

replies.message: Concur. Station assets reporting coordinated insurgent movement citywide.
QRF deploying from Bagram. ETA 45 minutes. Hold what you've got.
HUMINT indicates major assault within 48-72 hours.
Priority to those with valid visas and direct threats. Starting documentation now.

post.message:
Initial accountability:
- 523 American citizens
- 278 embassy staff
- 890 local employees
- 456 contractors

Total potential evacuees: 2,147

Motor pool inventory:
- 23 armored vehicles operational
- 15 buses (600 pax capacity)
- Fuel for 72 hours ops

Need drivers briefed on emergency routes.

72-hour forecast:
- Clear next 24 hours
- Dust storm possible day 2
- Severe conditions likely day 3

Recommend accelerated timeline if weather holds.

Aircraft availability:
- 8x C-17 (3,200 pax total)
- 4x C-130 (600 pax total)
- Contract options limited

Can surge to 12 sorties daily if needed.

Meeting with MOD complete.

Host nation promises support but reliability questionable. Many officers have family ties to insurgents.

Recommend independent verification of all HN intel.

DIA assessment:
- 3,000+ insurgent fighters within 50km
- Heavy weapons confirmed
- MANPADS capability likely
- Attack timing: 48-96 hours

Medical capabilities:
- Embassy clinic: 10 beds
- Field hospital: 25 beds
- Surgical team on standby
- Blood supply: 72 hours

Requesting additional medical personnel from Bagram.

Marines from Bagram arriving now. Deploying:
- 2 rifle companies to embassy
- 1 company to airport
- QRF remaining mobile

Defensive positions will hold 72-96 hours max.

Station sources report:
- Lists of embassy employees circulating
- Targeted killings already started
- Safe houses compromised

Need to accelerate local staff evacuation.

Marine positions established:
- Sniper teams on high points
- MG nests at all gates
- Mortars registered on likely avenues
- Counter-assault team ready

We'll hold the line.

Route reconnaissance complete:
- Primary (highway): High traffic, exposed
- Secondary (Irish): Longer but covered
- Tertiary (camp road): Rough but defensible

Recommend varying routes to prevent ambush.

Consular section overwhelmed.

- 300+ Americans requesting evacuation docs
- 500+ visa applications from locals
- 24/7 operations initiated

Need additional consular officers.

First C-17 departing Ramstein.
- ETA Kabul: 0800 tomorrow
- Crew rest waived
- Max passengers authorized

Flight crews volunteering for extended duty.

Driver assignments complete:
- A Team: Embassy to airport (armed)
- B Team: Housing compounds (soft skin)
- C Team: Emergency response

All drivers briefed on duress procedures.

**CRISIS DAY 1 - 1200L**

NEO authorized by Washington. Classification: OPERATION SAFE HAVEN

Priorities:
1. American citizens
2. Allied nationals
3. Vulnerable local staff

Destruction of classified begins in 48 hours.

Imagery shows:
- Roadblocks appearing on major routes
- Technical vehicles massing in suburbs
- Possible mortar positions identified

 Recommend increasing security posture immediately.

Loadmaster planning:
- 150 pax per C-17 (normal)
- 400 pax emergency max
- Floor loading authorized
- Minimal baggage (1 bag per person)

We'll pack them in safely.

Political section contacts report government fragmenting.

Several ministries already abandoned. Military units defecting.

Can't rely on host nation beyond 48 hours.

Triage protocols activated:
- Priority 1: Life threatening
- Priority 2: Urgent
- Priority 3: Delayed
- Priority 4: Deceased

Pray we don't need them all.

Facility preparations underway:
- Classified storage consolidated
- Burn barrels positioned
- Emergency supplies distributed
- Safe haven areas designated

We're ready for siege conditions.

Housing compound sweeps:
- Building A: 127 accounted
- Building B: 89 accounted
- Building C: 43 missing

Search teams dispatched for missing personnel.

Tech team establishing:
- Encrypted comms with all stations
- Redundant networks online
- Jamming detection active
- Emergency broadcasts ready

Comms will stay up until the end.

**1800Z Weather Update**

Satellite showing massive dust formation building in west.
- Current conditions: Clear
- 24hr: Increasing winds
- 48hr: Possible dust storm
- 72hr: Severe conditions likely

Window is narrowing.

First convoy run complete:
- 89 dependents delivered to airport
- No incidents
- 15 minute transit time
- Route Alpha still clear

Ready for next run.

**CRISIS DAY 1 - 1400L**

Progress report:
- 312 evacuated
- 2 aircraft departed
- Zero casualties
- Routes still open

Maintaining operational tempo. Expect conditions to deteriorate tonight.

HUMINT flash:

Insurgent leaders meeting tonight. Planning coordinated assault.

Expect probing attacks within 12 hours. Main assault 48-72 hours.

Recommend maximum evacuations next 24 hours.

East gate incident:
- Vehicle approached at high speed
- Warning shots fired
- Vehicle retreated
- Possible reconnaissance

Increasing security posture all gates.

C-17 #89-1192 on approach.
- Tactical arrival authorized
- Expecting ground time: 45 minutes
- Manifest: 312 pax out

Ground crews standing by.

Medical evacuation #1:
- 3 pregnant women (high risk)
- 5 chronic care patients
- 2 injured contractors

All stable for flight. Accompanying medical team.

Community message sent:

'All American citizens report to embassy by 0800 tomorrow. Bring passport, one bag, water, medications. Evacuation processing will begin immediately.'

1,100+ responses already.

My sources in insurgent areas report:

They have lists. Names, addresses of everyone who worked with Americans.

My men are terrified. Some deserting to get families out.

Please help us.

replies.message: Colonel, we won't abandon you. Get me a list of your people.

post.message:
SIGINT intercept:

'Attack tomorrow sunrise. Hit the convoys. Block the airport road. Paradise is near.'

Assess credible threat to morning operations. Recommend night movements only.

South gate crowd growing:
- 200+ locals demanding entry
- Women and children visible
- Situation tense but controlled
- Warning shots authorized if rushed

Need guidance on local staff without badges.

Night operations commencing:
- NVG qualified crews only
- Blacked out approaches
- No runway lights
- Minimal ground time

6 sorties planned tonight.

Convoy casualties treated:
- 1x shrapnel wounds (stable)
- 1x concussion (monitoring)
- Multiple minor lacerations

Both will evacuate with next flight.

Night weather favorable:
- Clear skies
- Light winds
- Good visibility
- No moon (tactical advantage)

Green light for night ops.

New convoy SOP:
- Minimum 3 vehicle packets
- Lead and trail guns
- Varied routes mandatory
- Radio checks every 60 seconds
- Abort authority to convoy commander

No more solo runs.

**CRISIS DAY 1 - 2200L**

Night Phase Status:
- 623 evacuated today
- 12 aircraft movements
- 2 WIA (minor)
- Threat level increasing

All stations maintain 50% security overnight.

Missing persons update:
- 23 located (were in bunkers)
- 11 confirmed departed on own
- 9 still unaccounted for

Families notified where possible.

Night surveillance detected:
- Movement in abandoned buildings
- Possible sniper positions
- Vehicle staging areas identified

Expect harassment fire tonight. Major assault still 36-48 hours out.

Station sources confirm:

Tonight was probing attack. Testing response times.

Main assault force still organizing. Mix of regular fighters and foreign elements.

Window narrowing but still have 36 hours.

Night sortie 1 complete:
- 389 pax evacuated
- Tactical approach successful
- No ground fire received
- 28 minute turnaround

Outstanding ground crew performance.

Police checkpoints abandoning positions.

My unit still loyal but isolated. Request permission to consolidate at embassy.

42 officers and families total. All vetted.

replies.message: Permission granted. Bring them in tonight.

post.message:
Route recon update:
- Alpha: Clear but exposed
- Bravo: Compromised (IED confirmed)
- Charlie: Unknown (avoided)
- Delta: Checking now

Recommend creating new routes each run.

Burn injuries from rocket attack:
- 2 contractors (minor)
- 1 Marine (2nd degree)

All treated and stable. Marine refusing evacuation. 'Not leaving my post.'

**CRISIS DAY 2 - 0200L**

Harassing attacks confirmed. Embassy holding.

Accelerating evacuation of all non-essential personnel. Local staff with credible threats move to priority list.

@james.carter How long can we hold?

replies.message: 72 hours if supplied. 48 if things deteriorate. Need more ammunition.

post.message:
0300 weather check:

Dust storm still building west. Now showing:
- Arrival time: 30-36 hours
- Severity: Category 3
- Duration: 12-24 hours

Will shut down all flight ops when it hits.

West gate probe:
- 5-6 individuals approached
- Threw items over wall
- Retreated when illuminated
- Items were recon cameras

They're mapping our positions.

0400 accountability:
- 1,247 evacuated (cumulative)
- 826 remaining at embassy
- 74 at airport awaiting flights
- ~300 in housing areas

Morning surge expected at 0600.

Priority intel:

Insurgent commander issued dawn attack order. Cancelled last minute.

Assess: Waiting for more fighters or weather advantage.

Buys us 24 hours but increases ultimate threat.

Night ops summary:
- 6 sorties completed
- 2,145 evacuated overnight
- Zero incidents
- Crews resting until 0800

Exceptional performance by all.

Dawn convoy brief:

Expect contact today. All convoys:
- Minimum 4 vehicles
- QRF pre-positioned
- Drone overwatch when available
- Abort threshold lowered

We'll fight through but not into ambushes.

**CRISIS DAY 2 - 0600L**

SITREP:
- Embassy secure after minor probes
- 3,392 total evacuated
- Weather window: 30 hours
- Threat: Increasing

Today is critical. Maximum effort required.

Dawn imagery shows:
- 200+ vehicles massing 15km south
- Multiple mortar positions prepared
- VBIED factory identified
- Fighters moving into city

Assault imminent within 24-36 hours.

Document destruction commencing:
- Non-critical classified first
- Maintaining operational files only
- Burn time: 8 hours estimated
- Smoke will be visible

Expect crowds to react to smoke.

Ministry of Defense abandoned.

Military units fragmenting. Some joining insurgents.

My police the only government force in sector. We stay with Americans.

Hospital overwhelmed with:
- Panic attacks
- Heat casualties  
- Crowd crush injuries
- Chronic conditions

Need to evacuate medical cases before situation deteriorates.

Morning surge begun:
- 400+ at gates
- Processing at capacity
- Crowd control challenging
- Emotions running high

Local staff desperate. Heartbreaking decisions.

CONVOY CONTACT - Route Delta

RPG near miss. Small arms ineffective.
Pushing through. 2 km from airport.

Crowd surge at airport gate blocking entry.

replies.message: Airport security clearing path. Hold position until clear.

post.message:
**0900 Weather WARNING**

Dust storm accelerating. Revised timeline:
- Arrival: 20-24 hours
- Severity: Upgrading to Category 4
- Visibility: Zero expected
- Duration: 18-36 hours

Flying window closing faster than expected.

Surge operations authorized:
- Reduced crew rest
- Maximum density loading
- 30-minute turnarounds
- Combat approaches only

Aircrews pushing limits but motivated.

NSA flash:

Intercepts indicate insurgents aware of weather window. Planning to attack when dust grounds aircraft.

'Wait for Allah's wind, then strike.'

Crowd situation critical:
- 1,000+ at gates
- Desperation increasing
- Fence climbing attempts
- Warning shots fired

Request permission for riot control measures.

replies.message: Authorized. Minimum force. These are desperate people, not enemies.

post.message:
Creating citizen convoy:
- Walking evacuation approved
- 1,200 meter movement
- Marines screening flanks
- Medical teams embedded

Those who can walk, walk. Vehicles for mobility impaired only.

Drone feed showing:
- Insurgent scouts in city
- Roadblocks being prepared
- Sniper positions occupied
- VBIED moving north

Recommend immediate suspension of predictable convoy routes.

Triage decision required:

89 medical cases for evacuation. Only 30 aircraft spaces.

Prioritizing children, pregnant women, critical care. 

Having to turn away chronic cases. Hardest thing I've ever done.

**FLASH UPDATE - 1200L**

Intel indicates attack timeline moved up. Expect contact within 12 hours.

All non-essential personnel evacuate NOW. Begin final phase destruction of classified.

@sarah.mitchell Recommend ambassador depart next flight.

replies.message: Negative. I leave on the last flight.

post.message:
Aircraft stacking up:
- 3 C-17s holding
- 2 C-130s inbound
- Civilian contract requesting priority

Ground crews maxed out. 20 minute turns becoming 35.

Radio intercepts from insurgents:

'The Americans are burning papers. They are leaving. Paradise approaches. Prepare the welcome.'

They know. Expect accelerated timeline.

Heartbreaking update:

Having to close access to local staff without visas. 400+ at gates we cannot take.

Providing letters of recommendation. It's all we can do.

This will haunt us.

**MASS CASUALTY - Airport Road**

VBIED hit civilian crowd. 50+ casualties.
Not our convoy but blocking route.
Diverting all convoys to alternate.

Medical teams responding.

**1500 CRITICAL WEATHER**

Dust storm accelerating dramatically.
- New arrival: 10-12 hours
- Severity: Category 5
- Duration: Unknown

Last flights must depart by 0200 tomorrow.

Final phase initiated.

All remaining personnel prepare for departure by 0100. Essential security only remains after that.

Destroy all remaining classified NOW. Embassy closure imminent.

CRITIC intel:

Major assault force moving. 800+ fighters. Heavy weapons.
Target: Airport and embassy simultaneously.
H-Hour: Tonight after midnight.

We're out of time.

Volunteer crew stepping up:

'We'll fly into hell if it saves lives.'

Planning max density loads. 500+ per C-17.
Safety margins waived. Getting everyone out.

VBIED casualties overwhelming airport medical.

- 18 DOA
- 34 critical  
- 50+ wounded
- Blood supplies exhausted

Doing battlefield medicine in departure lounge.

Final convoy loading at embassy:

- Ambassador and country team
- Last 300 Americans
- Critical local staff
- Destruction complete

This is the last run from embassy.

Flag lowered. Charges set.

All classified destroyed. Embassy prepared for abandonment.

Last Marines loading up. It's been an honor.

Insurgent forces 5km from airport.

Multiple axis of advance. Mortars within range.

Recommend immediate departure all aircraft.

Casualty update:
- 11 KIA (7 host nation, 4 US)
- 47 wounded evacuated
- Blood supplies critical

These people died trying to reach freedom.

**2200 - FINAL PHASE**

Embassy abandoned. Final convoy en route airport.
Weather closing in. Enemy forces massing.

All aircraft prepare for immediate departure once convoy arrives.

My last police have withdrawn to airport.

City falling. Insurgents control all approaches.

Thank you for trying to save our country. Now please save our people.

Wall of dust visible on horizon.

Time remaining: 4 hours maximum.
Visibility dropping already.
Winds increasing to 45 knots.

This is it.

Final aircraft manifest:
- C-17 #1: Loading casualties
- C-17 #2: Embassy personnel
- C-130 #1: Remaining civilians
- C-130 #2: Security forces

Engines running. Go decision in minutes.

All aircraft - emergency departure authorized.

Load who you can. Leave when ready.
Do not wait for full manifest.

God speed to all.

Station terminated.

All networks down. Assets dispersed.
20 years of work ending in chaos.

Final message: We tried. History will judge.

Loading wounded on C-17.

More casualties than spaces. Making impossible choices.
Children first. Then women. Then wounded who can survive.

Forgive us for those we leave.

Terminal secured. Final personnel inside.

Insurgents 200 meters and closing.
Ammunition critical. Time running out.

Last aircraft must depart NOW.

All aircraft airborne.

Operation Safe Haven complete.
4,892 souls evacuated.

We did our duty. We kept faith. We brought them home.

All aircraft clear of threat envelope.

Heading for safe airspace.
Weather prevented pursuit.

Sometimes dust storms are blessings.

Looking down at my burning country.

But my family lives. My men who stayed loyal live.

America kept its promise to those it could save.

We will remember.

**FINAL EVACUATION TALLY**

- US citizens: 1,234
- Allied nationals: 567
- Local staff: 1,789
- Others saved: 1,302

Those left behind: Unknown thousands

We did our best.

Final medical count:
- 23 KIA total
- 97 WIA evacuated
- 2 babies born during evac
- Countless lives saved

Medical teams performed miracles.
